full_text.full_text:
Characteristics of k-NN Classifiers (2/3)
4. They produce decision boundaries of arbitrary shape
– More flexible then rectilinear decision boundaries of decision trees
– Increasing k may reduce its flexibility
5. They have difficulty handling missing values in both the training 
and test sets
– Since proximity computations normally require the presence of all 
attributes
